member.name: P:UnitComboLib.ViewModel.UnitViewModel.ScreenPoints
member.summary: Currently selected value in screen points. This property is needed because the run-time system cannot work with percent values directly. Therefore, this property always ensures a correct font size no matter what the user selected in percent.

member.summary: Get list of units, their default value lists, itemkeys etc.

member.name: P:UnitComboLib.ViewModel.UnitViewModel.Item(System.String)
member.summary:
Standard property that is part of the interface.
Evaluetes whether StringValue parameter represents a value within the expected range and sets a corresponding errormessage in the ValueTip property if not.
Source: http://joshsmithonwpf.wordpress.com/2008/11/14/using-a-viewmodel-to-provide-meaningful-validation-error-messages/
